newsitem.title: SWEDEN: P&U, Takeda in joint marketing deal.
newsitem.headline: P&U, Takeda in joint marketing deal.

text.p: Swedish/U.S. drugs group Pharmacia & Upjohn said on Wednesday that it had signed a joint marketing agreement with Japan's Takeda Chemical Industries Ltd for products to help people stop smoking.
The agreement enables Takeda to sell smoking cessation aid products of P&U in Japan, P&U said in a statement.
"The agreement covers P&U's nicotine replacement therapy products in form of chewing gum and transdermal patch," the statement said.
P&U's chewing gum under the brand name Nicorette has been marketed in Japan since 1994 as a prescription-only drug.
But P&U said Takeda would start parallel marketing of the gum under the brand name Nicotrol after seeking government approval for switching the product to an over-the-counter drug.
In addition, P&U and Takeda have agreed to co-develop the over-the-counter transdermal patch.
P&U said it would continue to market Nicorette as a prescription drug in Japan until it had approval to switch to an over-the-counter drug.
